reviewText:
the instructor gos through the motion at a moderate speed, but never stops to show how to go through the motions
it's fine if you know how to use the weapon.
To me this is too dangerous of a weapon to train with without proper explanation on the techniques.
The video show a top view and a side view, but never stops to say this is how you do the moves themselves.

Ok I must say this is a good DVD to get for a reference if you want to learn this weapon, I have gotten other DVD that made me fill intimidated by this weapon but I got this one and it's pretty good I must say and it's easy to fallow him when he is doing the examples so yeah I give it a 10.

This is NOT a training DVD.  It is a video of a form and that is about it.  You would be better off getting something a bit more specific to how to control the three sectional as opposed to watching someone just go through the moves.

The person in the video is skilled and an excellent artist. In fact he is so advanced that a beginner may have trouble following his movements. He does not do a lot of teaching--he performs demonstrations.
